byline.contributor: Thomas Fuller was the Southeast Asia correspondent for The International Herald Tribune and The New York Times from 2006 until this month. He has taken a new posting as the San Francisco bureau chief.

abstract: Thomas Fuller Reporter's Notebook reflects on decade of covering news in Southeast Asia; suggests recurrent theme of all stories he covered is that of impunity of authorities and elites, and observes that corruption in region is rampant.
lead_paragraph: Thomas Fuller, a New York Times correspondent who is leaving the region after a decade, says one theme there keeps recurring: impunity.

headline.main: Reporting on Life, Death and Corruption in Southeast Asia
headline.print_headline: Naked Corruption, Up Close and Personal in Asia

snippet: Thomas Fuller, a New York Times correspondent who is leaving the region after a decade, says one theme there keeps recurring: impunity.
